title: Travel Safely in Deep Snow Without Snowshoes
brief: Improvise snowshoes and navigate safely through snow 30+ cm deep to avoid leaving obvious trails.
steps: Step 1: Make improvised snowshoes using willow branches, strips of cloth, leather, or similar materials when snow is 30+ cm deep.
Step 2: Avoid snow-covered streams as snow insulation may prevent ice formation over water.
Step 3: In hilly terrain, avoid areas where avalanches appear possible.
Step 4: Travel in early morning hours in avalanche-prone areas when snow is most stable.
Step 5: On ridges, stay away from cornices (overhanging snow piles on lee side) that extend far from the ridge.
warnings: Do not travel in deep snow without snowshoes or skis - it's almost impossible and leaves obvious trails for pursuers.
Never step on cornices - they can break loose and cause falls or avalanches.
Avoid snow-covered streams as the water underneath may not be frozen.
source: FM21-76_SurvivalManual.pdf — U.S. Department of the Army
